intro: Odontarrhena clypeolata, commonly known as the African sandmat, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its unique, tubular flowers that are often brightly colored. The plant typically grows in sandy or rocky soils and is adapted to arid environments. Its leaves are opposite and often have a hairy texture, while its stem is erect and branching. Odontarrhena clypeolata is also known for its medicinal properties and has been used in traditional medicine for various ailments.
